data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: In a certain sense the Good is comfortless.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: It is comforting to reflect that the disproportion of things in the world seems to be only arithmetical.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The thornbush is the old obstacle in the road. It must catch fire if you want to go further.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: You can hold yourself back from the sufferings of the world, that is something you are free to do and it accords with your nature, but perhaps this very holding back is the one suffering you could avoid.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: How can one take delight in the world unless one flees to it for refuge?

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: It is only our conception of time that makes us call the Last Judgement by this name. It is, in fact, a kind of martial law.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: We are separated from God on two sides; the Fall separates us from Him, the Tree of Life separates Him from us.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: A book must be the ax for the frozen sea within us.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: A first sign of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: There are only two things. Truth and lies. Truth is indivisible, hence it cannot recognize itself; anyone who wants to recognize it has to be a lie.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Don Quixote's misfortune is not his imagination, but Sancho Panza.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Not everyone can see the truth, but he can be it.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: A stair not worn hollow by footsteps is, regarded from its own point of view, only a boring something made of wood.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Writers speak stench.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Self-control means wanting to be effective at some random point in the infinite radiations of my spiritual existence.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Hesitation before birth. If there is a transmigration of souls then I am not yet on the bottom rung. My life is a hesitation before birth.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Heaven is dumb, echoing only the dumb.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Hiding places there are innumerable, escape is only one, but possibilities of escape, again, are as many as hiding places.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: A man of action forced into a state of thought is unhappy until he can get out of it.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The experience of life consists of the experience which the spirit has of itself in matter and as matter, in mind and as mind, in emotion, as emotion, etc.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: I do not read advertisements. I would spend all of my time wanting things.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Dread of night. Dread of not-night.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: In the struggle between yourself and the world second the world.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The mediation by the serpent was necessary. Evil can seduce man, but cannot become man.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: My 'fear' is my substance, and probably the best part of me.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: A book should serve as the ax for the frozen sea within us.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: My peers, lately, have found companionship through means of intoxication - it makes them sociable. I, however, cannot force myself to use drugs to cheat on my loneliness - it is all that I have - and when the drugs and alcohol dissipate, will be all that my peers have as well.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Association with human beings lures one into self-observation.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Believing in progress does not mean believing that any progress has yet been made.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The Bible is a sanctum; the world, sputum.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: No sooner said than done - so acts your man of worth.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: If there is a transmigration of souls then I am not yet on the bottom rung. My life is a hesitation before birth.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The relationship to one's fellow man is the relationship of prayer, the relationship to oneself is the relationship of striving; it is from prayer that one draws the strength for one's striving.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: In the fight between you and the world, back the world.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: In argument similes are like songs in love; they describe much, but prove nothing.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Woman, or more precisely put, perhaps, marriage, is the representative of life with which you are meant to come to terms.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The fact that our task is exactly commensurate with our life gives it the appearance of being infinite.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Every revolution evaporates and leaves behind only the slime of a new bureaucracy.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Don't despair, not even over the fact that you don't despair.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The decisive moment in human evolution is perpetual. That is why the revolutionary spiritual movements that declare all former things worthless are in the right, for nothing has yet happened.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Always first draw fresh breath after outbursts of vanity and complacency.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Let me remind you of the old maxim: people under suspicion are better moving than at rest, since at rest they may be sitting in the balance without knowing it, being weighed together with their sins.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: It is not necessary that you leave the house. Remain at your table and listen. Do not even listen, only wait. Do not even wait, be wholly still and alone. The world will present itself to you for its unmasking, it can do no other, in ecstasy it will writhe at your feet.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Productivity is being able to do things that you were never able to do before.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: We all have wings, but they have not been of any avail to us and if we could tear them off, we would do so.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Test yourself on mankind. It is something that makes the doubter doubt, the believer believe.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Martyrs do not underrate the body, they allow it to be elevated on the cross. In this they are at one with their antagonists.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The indestructible is one: it is each individual human being and, at the same time, it is common to all, hence the incomparably indivisible union that exists between human beings.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Anyone who cannot come to terms with his life while he is alive needs one hand to ward off a little his despair over his fate... but with his other hand he can note down what he sees among the ruins.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: In theory there is a possibility of perfect happiness: To believe in the indestructible element within one, and not to strive towards it.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Suffering is the positive element in this world, indeed it is the only link between this world and the positive.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: There is nothing besides a spiritual world; what we call the world of the senses is the Evil in the spiritual world, and what we call Evil is only the necessity of a moment in our eternal evolution.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: I have the true feeling of myself only when I am unbearably unhappy.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Idleness is the beginning of all vice, the crown of all virtues.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: If it had been possible to build the Tower of Babel without climbing it, it would have been permitted.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Atlas was permitted the opinion that he was at liberty, if he wished, to drop the Earth and creep away; but this opinion was all that he was permitted.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: From a certain point onward there is no longer any turning back. That is the point that must be reached.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: May I kiss you then? On this miserable paper? I might as well open the window and kiss the night air.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Evil is whatever distracts.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: He who seeks does not find, but he who does not seek will be found.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: How pathetically scanty my self-knowledge is compared with, say, my knowledge of my room. There is no such thing as observation of the inner world, as there is of the outer world.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: We are sinful not only because we have eaten of the Tree of Knowledge, but also because we have not yet eaten of the Tree of Life. The state in which we are is sinful, irrespective of guilt.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Religions get lost as people do.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: One advantage in keeping a diary is that you become aware with reassuring clarity of the changes which you constantly suffer.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Tyranny or slavery, born of selfishness, are the two educational methods of parents; all gradations of tyranny or slavery.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: It is often safer to be in chains than to be free.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: By imposing too great a responsibility, or rather, all responsibility, on yourself, you crush yourself.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The history of mankind is the instant between two strides taken by a traveler.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: So long as you have food in your mouth, you have solved all questions for the time being.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: Sensual love deceives one as to the nature of heavenly love; it could not do so alone, but since it unconsciously has the element of heavenly love within it, it can do so.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: If I shall exist eternally, how shall I exist tomorrow?

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: One must not cheat anyone, not even the world of its victory.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: The spirit becomes free only when it ceases to be a support.

data.author: Franz Kafka
data.en: One tells as few lies as possible only by telling as few lies as possible, and not by having the least possible opportunity to do so.
